metadata.title: CVE-2021-23963 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
When sharing geolocation during an active WebRTC share, Firefox could have reset the webRTC sharing state in the user interface, leading to loss of control over the currently granted permission. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 85.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-23963` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
